abstract: Sebastian Vettel finished third in the Japanese Grand Prix and became the youngest double world champion in Formula One history, while Jenson Button won the race.
snippet: Sebastian Vettel finished third in the Japanese Grand Prix and became the youngest double world champion in Formula One history, while Jenson Button won the race.
lead_paragraph: SUZUKA, Japan -- In winning the drivers' title at the Japanese Grand Prix on Sunday with four races left, Sebastian Vettel has extinguished any doubts about just how good a driver he is. With nine victories and 12 pole positions this season, he is the youngest double world champion ever.

headline.main: Vettel Wins Title, but Button Wins Race
